item.title: Jayme add a quote by Henry Miller
item.description: "I have always looked upon decay as being just as wonderful and rich an expression of life as growth." -- Henry Miller

item.title: Jayme add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "If wild my breast and sore my pride, I bask in dreams of suicide, If cool my heart and high my head I think 'How lucky are the dead." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Jayme add a quote by Morrissey
item.description: "Now I know how Joan of Arc felt." -- Morrissey

item.title: Jayme add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Description begins in the writer’s imagination, but should finish in the reader’s." -- Stephen King

item.title: Jayme add a quote by Thomas Mann
item.description: "A writer is someone for whom writing is more difficult than it is for other people." -- Thomas Mann

item.title: Jayme add a quote by Jack London
item.description: "You can't wait for inspiration. You have to go after it with a club." -- Jack London

item.title: Jayme add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "Cut out all these exclamation points. An exclamation point is like laughing at your own joke." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Jayme add a quote by Anais Nin
item.description: "The role of a writer is not to say what we can all say, but what we are unable to say." -- Anais Nin

item.title: Jayme add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "All you have to do is write one true sentence. Write the truest sentence that you know." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Jayme add a quote by E.L. Doctorow
item.description: "Writing is a socially acceptable form of schizophrenia." -- E.L. Doctorow

item.title: Jayme add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "A little talent is a good thing to have if you want to be a writer. But the only real requirement is the ability to remember every scar." -- Stephen King

item.title: Jayme add a quote by Jules Renard
item.description: "Writing is a way of talking without being interrupted." -- Jules Renard

item.title: Jayme add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "I hate writing, I love having written." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Jayme add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Write with the door closed, rewrite with the door open." -- Stephen King

item.title: Jayme add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description:
"the writing of some men is like a vast bridge that carries you over the many things that claw and tear.
The Wine of Forever" -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Jayme add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "A woman must have money and a room of her own if she is to write fiction." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Jayme add a quote by Stephen Fry
item.description: "Language is my whore, my mistress, my wife, my pen-friend, my check-out girl. Language is a complimentary moist lemon-scented cleansing square or handy freshen-up wipette. Language is the breath of God, the dew on a fresh apple, it's the soft rain of dust that falls into a shaft of morning sun when you pull from an old bookshelf a forgotten volume of erotic diaries; language is the faint scent of urine on a pair of boxer shorts, it's a half-remembered childhood birthday party, a creak on the stair, a spluttering match held to a frosted pane, the warm wet, trusting touch of a leaking nappy, the hulk of a charred Panzer, the underside of a granite boulder, the first downy growth on the upper lip of a Mediterranean girl, cobwebs long since overrun by an old Wellington boot." -- Stephen Fry

item.title: Jayme add a quote by T.S. Eliot
item.description: "Some editors are failed writers, but so are most writers." -- T.S. Eliot
